section.title: Efficiently Creating Bootable Volumes when using Ceph for Glance and Cinder

important.para: This section only applies if you are using Ceph as a backend for both Glance and Cinder. If you are only using Ceph as a backend for either Glance or Cinder, but not both, then this section would not apply.

section.para: By default, creation of multiple bootable volumes from an image in Glance can involve significant data movement. When Ceph is used as a backend for both Glance and Cinder, performance of these operations can be improved significantly. Glance can be configured (using the v2 API) to pass image locations to its client, and the Ceph backend can be configured to read the image locations and use an efficient Ceph clone operation to avoid data copies.

note.para: Image locations can only be made available with the Glance v2 API, which is not the default.

Log in to a controller node and create a cinder-advanced role using the OpenStack CLI tool, which eash user who will be creating bootable volumes should have:

note.para: If you wish to use a different role name than cinder-advanced you can, but ensure you update the rest of the example commands to match.

listitem.para: Update the ~/openstack/my_cloud/config/glance/policy.json.j2 file to provide the cinder-advanced role the permissions to perform the necessary API calls:
For each user who will be creating bootable volumes, add the cinder-advanced role for the necessary Projects with the following OpenStack CLI command:
For example, to provide the demo user permission to efficiently create bootable volumes in the demo project, you would use this command:
listitem.screen: openstack role add --project demo --user demo cinder-advanced

listitem.para: Edit the ~/openstack/my_cloud/config/glance/glance-api.conf.j2 file to uncomment and change the line #show_image_direct_url = False and add the line show_multiple_locations = True:
listitem.screen:
CHANGE: from: #show_image_direct_url = False to: show_image_direct_url = True
ADD: show_multiple_locations = True

listitem.para: Commit your configuration to the Git repository (), as follows:
listitem.screen: cd ~/openstack/ardana/ansible git add -A git commit -m "My config or other commit message"

listitem.para: Change to the deployment directory and run both the Glance and Cinder reconfigure playbooks:
listitem.screen: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/ardana/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts glance-reconfigure.yml ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts cinder-reconfigure.yml
